nodes.text: Jaguada was a desert planet and one of many worlds of the ancient Sith. According to legend, the Sith Lord Darth Noctyss carried out research on the planet that eventually led her to the lost Sith world of Exegol in her quest to attain immortality. In the time of the Galactic Republic, Jaguada was quarantined, and its affiliation to the Sith was hidden from history.

In the new Star Wars canon, Jaguada was first mentioned in Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker: The Visual Dictionary, written by Pablo Hidalgo and published in 2019. Jaguada later made its first canonical appearance in the 2020 short story "A Life Immortal," written by George Mann and illustrated by Grant Griffin. In the Star Wars Legends continuity, Jaguada first appeared in the 2005 novel Dark Lord: The Rise of Darth Vader, written by James Luceno.
